content: On October 13, 1996, the Atlanta Braves secured their place in the World Series by defeating the St. Louis Cardinals 15-0 in Game 6 of the National League Championship Series. This decisive victory at Busch Stadium marked the Braves' fourth consecutive NL pennant, showcasing an explosive offensive performance highlighted by a grand slam from Ryan Klesko and a stellar pitching effort from Greg Maddux. The game remains one of the most memorable moments in Braves postseason history, as it propelled the team into the World Series against the New York Yankees.
